intro: Thesium brachycephalum, commonly known as the narrow-headed thesium, is a low-growing perennial plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color, arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are linear and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant adaptations. Thesium brachycephalum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
